channel.title: Can't portforward?
channel.description:
soo, i have a Linksys WRT120N wireless router, and when i try to go to the web interface, the box that asks for the username and pass keeps coming back after i enter the user/pass thing. I've tried the factory defaults (admin, administrator, password, etc.) and I've tried every pass i can think of that could have been used for it. i've tried the automatic port forwarding .jar thing, but it always says something like "cannot automatically portforward" in the servers cmd prompt. Also I've tried utorrent, i followed a guide on here, and i leave utorrent up, i have my no-ip updated, but i still can't log into my server.
anyone know why I can't portforward, or maybe another way to do it if there is a way

item.title: Can't portforward?
item.dc:creator: @bigbaddrag bigbaddrag
item.description:
@bigbaddrag wrote:

[quote=“smkscape, post:3, topic:351590”]You can, follow this:

http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Linksys/WRT120N/Runescape_Private_Server.htm

Also make sure your firewall is off or enabled the port you are using for your server.[/quote]

that would work, except i can’t get to the routers web interface, it wont accept any passwords and such that i try. I’ve also tried holding the reset button for 30 and 60 seconds, still nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't portforward?
item.dc:creator: @smkscape smkscape
item.description:
@smkscape wrote:

You can, follow this:

http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Linksys/WRT120N/Runescape_Private_Server.htm

Also make sure your firewall is off or enabled the port you are using for your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't portforward?
item.dc:creator: @Da_Vinci Da Vinci
item.description:
@Da_Vinci wrote:

[quote=“bigbaddrag, post:1, topic:351590”]soo, i have a Linksys WRT120N wireless router, and when i try to go to the web interface, the box that asks for the username and pass keeps coming back after i enter the user/pass thing. I’ve tried the factory defaults (admin, administrator, password, etc.) and I’ve tried every pass i can think of that could have been used for it. i’ve tried the automatic port forwarding .jar thing, but it always says something like “cannot automatically portforward” in the servers cmd prompt. Also I’ve tried utorrent, i followed a guide on here, and i leave utorrent up, i have my no-ip updated, but i still can’t log into my server.

anyone know why I can’t portforward, or maybe another way to do it if there is a way[/quote]

Okay as you’ve tried the defaults the best thing to do is to reset your router, push the small reset button with a needle or whatever and hold it for 30 seconds. Then you can log in with factory defaults and set it up.

Read full topic
